intro: Cynanchum celebicum, commonly known as the Celebes milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the island of Celebes (now known as Sulawesi) in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae, which includes milkweeds and other plants with distinctive floral structures. The plant is characterized by its slender stems, opposite leaves, and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous minute, wind-dispersed seeds. Cynanchum celebicum is often found in tropical moist forests and is adapted to thrive in humid, shaded environments.
